metadata.title: CVE-2018-6052 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
Lack of support for a non standard no-referrer policy value in Blink inGoogle Chrome prior to 64.0.3282.119 allowed a remote attacker to obtainreferrer details from a web page that had thought it had opted out ofsending referrer data.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-6052` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu1
chromium-browser-l10n - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu1
chromium-chromedriver - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '64.0.3282.119-0ubuntu1').
